history.content:
Out of the above classes 188 is the most easily self-studied; 189 is also something you could self study with 126 and 127 under your belt. 


The hardest classes to self study are the project based classes, because a lot of your learning happens while doing the projects. However, the two most important ones for someone going into industry (162 and 186) are pretty heavy, as are 126, 127 and 61C. 

168 is an architectural class, and therefore a class better taken at Berkeley than self-learnt, because a lot of the class revolves around Prof. Shenker taking you through why certain design decisions were/should have been made, something harder to grasp from a textbook.

I would therefore suggest:

Fall: 61C, 126, 168

Spring: 186, 127, 161 (or, if you think you can handle the high workload, 162 instead of 186) 

(Note: I am not aware if any of these classes clash next semester)

Source: Have taken, from that list,  61C, 161, 126, 168, 188, 189, and have heard from my friends about 162, 186, 127.

children.subject:
• Don't think it's necessarily a mistake to not take 189 while still in school - it's a nice class to take (I loved it) but definitely self-teachable with the right math background

  • 126 and 127 are more fundamental courses, where doing the problem sets week in week out builds rigor, so you probably want to do them as classes instead of self-studying them

  • That current plan looks like complete hell in the Spring (126 + 127 + 162 looks like an obscenely high workload semester); I'd suggest swapping 126 and 186 in the Fall, and taking two out of (186, 127, 162) along with a lighter tech in the Spring.

Thanks for all the advice!

61c, 126, (168 or 186)
162, 127, (161 or 186)

So I wont' take 1 of the following: 168, 161, 186. It'll come down to which is easiest to self study. You gave valid reasons why I should take each one, so i'll figure it out before Phase 2.

Thank you, that was a great response.

Do you think it's a mistake to not take 189 while still in school? Also, is 126 or 127 chill to self study since they are math courses?

Based on your advice, this is the current plan:

61c, 186, (168 or 161, whichever is harder to self study)
126, 127, 162

But ideally, i'd like to take 161 at Berkeley since it has projects.

1. I have internship experience.
2. I don't know anything about operating systems.
3. If a class is easier to self study, I'd love to know. I won't take it then.
4. My Linear Algebra and Probability skills are very far from my goals.
5. I'm in no particular rush to become very good at Machine Learning. So i'm open to following Sahai's advice and taking 126 and 127 first.
6. My interests in Computer Science are Mobile and Full Stack. But I have little experience with Machine Learning and Security Engineering.
7. I love reading textbooks, which is why i'm down to self study material.
8. Main goals are preparation for Industry and solid introduction to a realm of CS so i'll know if i'm interested.
history.subject: Course Advice. 2 more semesters. I will take 6 of these, and self study the rest.
